title: Sydney .NET user group: January
sessionTitle: ASP.NET 5 De-bamboozled - Lessons I wish someone else had learned - Adam Stephensen
eventShortDescription:
​***Note: location has changed. This user group will be held at 6.30pm at SSW Neutral Bay - Gateway Court Suite 15, 81-91 Military Road, Neutral Bay***


ASP.NET 5 De-bamboozled - Lessons I wish someone else had learned - Adam Stephensen

The change from ASP.NET 4 to ASP.NET 5 brings a whole lot of awesome to web development, but it’s the biggest change since MVC was introduced and the learning curve is massive. 

We shipped 2 enterprise apps on ASP.NET 5 while it was still in Beta (wow, that hurt).

Don’t spend weeks trying to understand how to get your new project right.

This session isn't just 'hello world', it's the stuff we wish we'd known in those first head-scratching weeks.

Come along and learn what we took months to figure out in just 2 hours.

About the presenter
Adam Stephensen is a Solution Architect at SSW, Qld General Manager and head mentor at FireBootCamp, the gruelling 9 week boot camp for .NET developers. He loves delivering high quality, scalable, enterprise solutions. He has a passion for Scrum, Continuous Delivery, and software craftsmanship. This has led him to mentor and contribute to many .NET projects across a broad range of technologies.

Can't come in person? No worries! 
We live stream the event so you can watch it from anywhere! Catch all the action live on Wednesday January 20 from 6:30pm here: http://www.ssw.com.au/ssw/NETUG/Live.aspx
